titleStmt.author: Blount, W[illia]m

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter to the] Speaker and the Gentlemen of the House of Representatives / W[illia]m Blount
bibl.author: Blount, W[illia]m
bibl.note: This is a letter to the House of Representatives, probably of the Tennessee General assembly from William Blount. The date is unknown. Blount proposes that the repairs to the road from Southwest Point to Sumner County should be given to a joint committee to oversee.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine: Mr Speaker and Gentlemen of the House of Representatives

div.p: The Senate do not concur with you in referring the petition from Sundry inhabitants of Mero District, praying that the Road from South West Point to Sumner County be repaired, & propose that it be refered referred to a joint committee of the two houses & name on their part Mr Douglass & Mr. Rutledge To which they request your concurrence

address.addrLine: G George Roulstone C. S. Clerk of the Senate

closer.add:
respecting the road
from S. W. South West Point to
Sumner County
